website_summaries.verdict: A good ice axe that is super lightweight and works well on snowy terrain.
pros: A heavy duty, high quality product
Aluminum shaft with a steel pick
Comes with a strong nylon strap leash
A good price for a Petzl
cons: This is a good axe for a weekend warrior, but Petzl makes higher-end axes for more serious adventurers

customer_reviews.title: Great Ice Axe - but CHECK YOUR SIZE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it's beautiful (blue is my favorite color), and it was lightweight. I highly recommend measuring that this will be the right size for you before buying. I am about 5 foot 5 inches, and this was way too short and not functional for me, so I had to replace it. Not hating on the quality or product at all, just want to caution people to pay attention to size so you don't end up having to purchase something new :)
customer_reviews.author: Allyson

customer_reviews.title: It works, doubles as excellent decoration to intimidate friends and family.
customer_reviews.text: I opted for the long model (75cm), mostly because I like to get a lot of leverage when self arresting. It works well, and will probably last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Huras

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, light.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent ice penetration, used it to go up mt washington in the winter and practice some self arrest, and snow/ice belay anchoring. Super light too, also used it for some light ice and rock climbing -- in small 20-30 foot sections at about 80 degree grade.
customer_reviews.author: Arch Quain

customer_reviews.title: so you can't easily use it as a walking stick like most do ...
customer_reviews.text: On a five day summer glacier traverse my buddies were jealous that my axe was so light! It is quite short, so you can't easily use it as a walking stick like most do for climbing. But I feel that once it is steep enough to really need it, then the length is good. I love that it is small and light, cause there is a ton of time that you are not using it.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Buckley

customer_reviews.title: What value would you place on your life?
customer_reviews.text: This thing was worth every penny as it saved my life not once but twice. I slipped several times while hiking across America on the Pacific Crest Trail but once at once at Rock Pass and another at slip at White Pass was where this pick axe came in as a necessity that saved my life. Make sure you know how to use it properly but as long as there’s no user error, it will not fail you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong, balanced and beautiful
customer_reviews.text: This axe just feels better than other axes.The balance is perfect, the spike is extra sharp, and the teeth are grippy. You pick it up and you want to swing. It weighs next to nothing, but it hits snow hard. This is by far the best ice axe I've tried in it's price range. If you're looking for a smallish ice axe, get this one.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Works great for self arresting and the spike was good for ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a 22 day mountaineering course with outward bound in the maroon bells. Works great for self arresting and the spike was good for self-belaying. It is also incredibly light and good for long trips with heavy packs. I am short, so if you are taller you might want a longer ice axe like the petzl summit.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Good ice axe.
customer_reviews.text: I used this on The Pacific Crest Trail in the Sierra's this year. It was very light weight and functionable.
customer_reviews.author: armmcin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome

product_meta.title: Petzl - GLACIER, Lightweight Performance Ice Axe for Glacier Travel
product_meta.description: Meticulously designed for glacier travel, the Petzl Glacier Ice Axe features a durable anodized aluminum shaft with a machined handle for superior grip.
feature_bullets: HIGH QUALITY: The GLACIER's high-quality steel pick is identical to technical ice axe picks. The pick is designed to make cutting steps, anchoring, and penetrating hard snow easy.
LIGHTWEIGHT: Weighing between 350 and 390 grams (depending on length), the GLACIER won't weigh you down on long treks and climbs.
HANDLE: Choose 60, 68, or 75 cm lengths. The shaft is made from high-quality anodized aluminum that resists rusting.

EASY TO USE: The GLACIER features a handle cut into the shaft that provides you better grip when technical ice climbing. Additionally, the upper part of the pick offers excellent grip and serves as a comfortable support surface.
EXTRAS: Both the head and spike are equipped with holes for clipping a carabiner or attaching a sling. The GLACIER ice axe comes with the LINKIN leash.
